block.p: THE hot dog has made a big impact not just on our diets but on our landscape as well.

THE hot dog has made a big impact not just on our diets but on our landscape as well.
As you contemplate these signs of the hot dog's influence on New Jersey, consider these facts:
Every year, Americans eat about 20 billion hot dogs, which averages out to more than 60 hot dogs a person, according to the National Hot Dog and Sausage Council of the American Meat Institute.
The estimated seven billion dogs that Americans will eat between Memorial Day and Labor Day would be enough to crisscross the country 250 times if laid end to end to end, the council calculates.

Mustard remains the most popular hot dog topping, used regularly by 87.6 percent of Americans, according go the hot dog council. Another poll by Hebrew National put the mustard contingent at only 68 percent, ketchup at 47 percent and mayonnaise -- mayonnaise?? -- at 13 percent.
In 1957, the United States Chamber of Commerce officially designated July as National Hot Dog Month. How do you plan to celebrate? HOT DIGGITY! DOG DIGGITY! -- VIEWS
